intro: Croton camagueyanus, commonly known as the Camagueyan croton, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful foliage. The plant typically features alternate, palmate leaves that can vary in shape and coloration. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by spiny, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
